metadata.title: CVE-2020-25662 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description: A Red Hat only CVE-2020-12352 regression issue was found in the way theLinux kernel's Bluetooth stack implementation handled the initialization ofstack memory when handling certain AMP packets. This flaw allows a remoteattacker in an adjacent range to leak small portions of stack memory on thesystem by sending specially crafted AMP packets. The highest threat fromthis vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
